threat_description: Disruption of critical hotel operations through ransomware or other attacks

components.name: Hotel Management Infrastructure
components.description: Core IT systems supporting hotel operations

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-434: Unrestricted Upload of File with Dangerous Type

components.name: Mobile Concierge Application
components.description: Mobile apps providing guest services and information

threat_description: Unauthorized access to payment card data during processing

components.name: Mobile Payment Applications
components.description: Apps allowing guests to pay for services via mobile devices

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Inadequate data filtering or logging could reveal sensitive info to unauthorized parties.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Weak random token generation can allow attackers to predict session or transaction tokens.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Sensitive data, like API keys, can remain unencrypted in logs, config files, or databases.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: If the gateway does not verify the source of requests, attackers can spoof or tamper with transactions.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Tokenization service credentials may be stored insecurely or passed in plaintext.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Tokenization keys or secrets could be written to logs or config files without encryption.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Tokens or payment details transmitted unencrypted can be intercepted by attackers.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-330: Use of Insufficiently Random Values
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Predictable token generation undermines security, allowing guessing or duplication.

components.name: Point of Sale (POS) Systems

components.name: Electronic Key Card System

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Key card validation can be bypassed if an unprotected route or fallback process exists.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Predictable key or token generation can enable attackers to forge mobile credentials.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Employees can gain unauthorized rights if role-based access is improperly enforced.
